Define Documentation

#define FLUSSPFERD_LOADER ( exports,
context   ) 
Value:
extern "C" \
  void flusspferd_load( \
    ::flusspferd::object &exports, \
    ::flusspferd::object &context)

Define a module loader.

The parameter context contains the module's scope, which includes the require function. You can access it with

 context.get_property_object("require")

or

 context.call("require", "module-name")
Parameters:
exports The object containing the module exports.
context The root object for the module's scope.
#define FLUSSPFERD_LOADER_SIMPLE ( exports   ) 
Value:
extern "C" \
  void flusspferd_load( \
    ::flusspferd::object &exports, \
    ::flusspferd::object &)

Define a module loader ("simple": without context parameter).

Parameters:
exports The object containing the module exports.

Typedef Documentation

typedef void(* flusspferd::flusspferd_load_t)(object &exports, object &context)

The prototype for module loader functions.

Modules should define a function flusspferd_load (with extern "C") with this signature.

However, they should not define this function directly but rather use either FLUSSPFERD_LOADER or FLUSSPFERD_LOADER_SIMPLE, which will adapt to changes in the signature.

Function Documentation

void flusspferd::load_require_function ( object  container  ) 

Load the 'require()' function into container.

Creates a new instance of the require function.

Parameters:
container The object to load the function into.
